The Company

In this role, you will be a member of the VertiGIS team that is primarily responsible for the development of VertiGIS Studio technology and offering its related services. Over 1400 organizations around the world rely on VertiGIS Studio software to design, develop, and maintain web-based mapping applications. We believe geographic information can empower people to make better decisions about their lives, society, and the world around us. You can help us make a difference.

The Position

We are searching for a motivated and enthusiastic individual to help us ensure the ongoing quality of our web and mobile-based mapping solutions. You will work within our development teams and provide your expertise on issues surrounding quality assurance and control.

We are a strong supporter of the UVic co-op program. Many of our co-op students stay on full-time and kick start their careers at VertiGIS. A number of our top employees started with us as co-op students.

Responsibilities, depending on ability and experience, may include:

Test new features in VertiGIS Studio software products from user and functionality viewpoints
Report bugs, track defects, and resolve issues with the developers
Work in an Agile framework with frequent releases
Design manual test suites and create automated functional tests
Apply quality assurance and quality control procedures and best practices
Provide guidance and knowledge to other stakeholders within the company


Our Perks

Team / Career Growth

An opportunity to kick-start your career at a dynamic, growing company
Top-notch colleagues that like and respect one another
We listen to peoples' ideas-and act on them
A supportive environment with opportunity for training, professional development, and advancement
Challenging, interesting work
Cutting edge technology that improves the world around us
Bottomless book budget
Company summer and winter parties (that are fun to attend)

Reputation

We're recognized experts in our field; people around the world seek us out
Our clients like us

Office

A hybrid working model allowing employees to split time between the office and home
A central downtown location overlooking Victoria's Inner Harbour
An amazing rooftop patio
Secure bike storage and showers
Lunchtime yoga on Tuesdays and Thursdays
Good coffee (we know how important this is)

Learn more about working with us!

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Post-secondary background in computer science or related field.
Experience programming in Typescript or .NET is ideal.
Strong organizational skills and a keen eye for detail.
Enthusiasm and a passion for technology.
